derivation: from G4862 (συμφέρω) and G5342 (συμφέρω) (including its alternate);
kjv_def: be better for, bring together, be expedient (for), be good, (be) profit(-able for)
strongs_def: to bear together (contribute), i.e. (literally) to collect, or (figuratively) to conduce; especially (neuter participle as a noun) advantage
outline:
1. to bear or bring together
  2. to bear together or at the same time
    1. to carry with others
    2. to collect or contribute in order to help
    3. to help, be profitable, be expedient
